tasks.title: Setup Electron App Infrastructure
tasks.description: Initialize the Electron application with React + TypeScript, shadcn/ui components, and configure the basic project structure including IPC communication bridge and state management.
tasks.details: Create Electron app using electron-shadcn template. Configure TypeScript, React, and Tailwind CSS. Setup Zustand for state management. Implement Main and Renderer process structure. Create IPC communication layer with preload script for secure data passing. Initialize file structure: src/main (ipc/, git/, config/, scanner/), src/renderer (components/, hooks/, stores/, utils/), src/shared/. Configure Monaco Editor or CodeMirror as the code editor component.

subtasks.title: Scaffold Project Directory Structure
subtasks.description: Initialize the base Electron application and create the required folder hierarchy for main, renderer, and shared code.
subtasks.details:
Initialize the project repository. Create the root directories: src/main (with subfolders ipc/, git/, config/, scanner/), src/renderer (with subfolders components/, hooks/, stores/, utils/), and src/shared/. Set up the basic package.json structure for a monorepo-style Electron app.

</info added on 2025-12-26T12:32:42.208Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify all specified directories and subdirectories are created successfully in the file system.

subtasks.title: Configure TypeScript and Build Pipeline
subtasks.description: Set up TypeScript configurations and the build tool (Webpack or Vite) to handle the Electron main and renderer processes.
subtasks.details:
Configure tsconfig.json for both the main process (Node.js types) and renderer process (DOM types). Set up Vite or Webpack to bundle the React frontend. Configure build scripts to compile the main process and bundle the renderer. Ensure path aliases are set up for clean imports.
<info added on 2025-12-26T14:02:35.975Z>
TypeScript and Vite build pipeline configured using the project template. tsconfig.json includes proper path aliases (@/*). Vite configurations for main, preload, and renderer processes are established. Fixed case sensitivity issue in src/renderer.ts (app -> App). Linting passes successfully.
</info added on 2025-12-26T14:02:35.975Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Run the build and dev scripts to ensure TypeScript compilation succeeds without errors and the bundler processes start correctly.

subtasks.title: Setup React, Tailwind CSS, and shadcn/ui
subtasks.description: Configure the React frontend environment, integrate Tailwind CSS for styling, and initialize the shadcn/ui component library.
subtasks.details:
Install React, React DOM, and related types. Configure Tailwind CSS with the PostCSS plugin. Initialize shadcn/ui using the CLI to set up the components.json configuration file. Install a few basic components (e.g., Button, Card) to verify the setup. Wrap the application root with the necessary Theme providers.
<info added on 2025-12-26T15:37:57.831Z>
React 19, Tailwind CSS 4, and shadcn/ui are pre-configured in the project template. The components.json file is set up with proper aliases. Tailwind CSS is configured via the Vite plugin. Available UI components include Button, Toggle, ToggleGroup, and NavigationMenu. No additional setup is required.
</info added on 2025-12-26T15:37:57.831Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Start the application and render a test component from shadcn/ui to verify styling and functionality.

subtasks.title: Implement IPC Bridge and Preload Scripts
subtasks.description: Create a secure IPC communication layer using a preload script and contextBridge to interact between Main and Renderer processes.
subtasks.details:
Create a preload.ts file that exposes specific APIs via contextBridge.api. Configure the Main process (main/index.ts) to load this preload script. Define IPC handlers in the Main process for basic operations. Create corresponding TypeScript types in src/shared to ensure type safety across the IPC boundary.
<info added on 2025-12-26T15:40:21.217Z>
The project uses ORPC (MessageChannel-based RPC) for IPC communication instead of traditional contextBridge. The IPC bridge is already set up with src/ipc/handler.ts, src/ipc/router.ts, and src/ipc/context.ts. The preload script in src/preload.ts handles the ORPC server initialization. New IPC routes for the Claude Code Manager (scanner, git, config operations) will be added to src/ipc/ following the existing pattern in src/ipc/app/, src/ipc/theme/, etc.
</info added on 2025-12-26T15:40:21.217Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Send a ping/pong message from the Renderer process to the Main process via the exposed API and verify the response is received correctly.

subtasks.title: Initialize Zustand State Management
subtasks.description: Install and configure Zustand to handle global application state within the Renderer process.
subtasks.details:
Install the Zustand package. Create store files in src/renderer/stores. Define the initial store structure for core app data (e.g., UI state, project lists). Implement typed hooks for accessing and updating the store. Set up the provider or direct hook usage pattern as preferred.
<info added on 2025-12-26T15:42:20.325Z>
Zustand v5.0.9 installed. Created three stores: 1) appStore.ts - manages projects list, selection, sidebar state, search query, and tab management (open, close, switch tabs). 2) configStore.ts - manages hooks, rules, skills, agents, and settings configurations with CRUD operations. 3) index.ts - exports all stores and types. Stores use devtools middleware for debugging support.
</info added on 2025-12-26T15:42:20.325Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Create a test component that updates a Zustand store value and verify the UI re-renders to reflect the state change.

tasks.title: Implement Project Scanner & Discovery
tasks.description: Create a file system scanner to discover all git repositories on the computer and identify those containing .claude/ directories.
tasks.details: Implement Main process scanner using Node.js fs/promises to traverse file system recursively. Detect .git directories to identify git repositories. Check for .claude/ subdirectories within git repos. Cache discovered projects to avoid repeated scanning. Handle permission errors and inaccessible directories gracefully. Implement search/filter functionality for projects. Add favorites persistence using local storage or config file.
tasks.testStrategy: Test scanner on local machine with multiple git repositories. Verify all git projects are discovered correctly. Confirm .claude/ detection works. Test search/filter functionality. Validate error handling for restricted directories. Check favorites persistence across app restarts.

subtasks.title: Implement recursive directory traversal using Node.js fs/promises
subtasks.description: Create the foundational file system traversal module that recursively walks through directories starting from configurable root paths.
subtasks.details: Use Node.js fs/promises API with readdir and stat to traverse directories asynchronously. Implement configurable depth limits to prevent infinite loops or excessive scanning. Create a clean API for consuming the traversal results with event emitters for progress updates.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test traversal on various directory structures including nested folders, symlinks, and empty directories. Verify progress events fire correctly and depth limits are respected.

subtasks.title: Add logic to detect .git and .claude/ directories
subtasks.description: Implement detection logic to identify git repositories by finding .git directories and check for .claude/ subdirectories within those repositories.
subtasks.details: During traversal, check for .git directory presence to identify git repositories. When a git repo is found, check if it contains a .claude/ subdirectory. Build a data structure to store discovered projects with their paths and claude status.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create test directories with .git folders and verify detection. Test with mixed scenarios: git repos with .claude/, git repos without .claude/, non-git directories. Ensure only valid git repos are flagged.

subtasks.title: Handle permission errors and inaccessible directories gracefully
subtasks.description: Add robust error handling for permission errors, inaccessible directories, and other file system exceptions during scanning.
subtasks.details: Wrap all file system operations in try-catch blocks. Handle EACCES, EPERM, and ENOENT errors specifically. Log skipped directories with reasons without crashing the scanner. Implement retry logic with exponential backoff for transient errors.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test scanning directories with restricted permissions. Simulate permission errors to ensure graceful handling. Verify scanner continues after encountering errors and provides useful logging about skipped paths.

subtasks.title: Implement caching mechanism to optimize performance
subtasks.description: Create a caching layer to store discovered projects and avoid repeated expensive file system scans.
subtasks.details: Implement in-memory cache with TTL (time-to-live) for discovered projects. Persist cache to local file (JSON) for app restart recovery. Add cache invalidation strategy based on time or manual refresh. Compare file modification times to detect changes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify cache stores discovered projects correctly. Test cache persistence across app restarts. Validate cache invalidation triggers re-scan. Measure performance improvement with caching enabled vs disabled.

subtasks.title: Build search/filter and favorites persistence logic
subtasks.description: Implement search and filter functionality for discovered projects, along with favorites persistence using local storage or config file.
subtasks.details: Create search by project name and path with fuzzy matching. Implement filters for projects with/without .claude/ directories. Build favorites system with add/remove functionality. Persist favorites to local config file. Create IPC handlers for Renderer process communication.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test search with partial and exact matches. Verify filters correctly narrow results. Add/remove favorites and confirm persistence across app restarts. Test IPC communication between Main and Renderer processes.

subtasks.testStrategy: Test parsing with valid config file, verify error handling for missing file and malformed JSON

subtasks.title: Build JSON editor with validation for MCP configs
subtasks.description: Create a JSON editor component with validation for adding, editing, and removing MCP server configurations
subtasks.details: Implement Monaco or CodeMirror based JSON editor with real-time validation against MCP config schema. Add UI buttons for add/edit/delete operations. Validate JSON structure before saving. Display syntax errors clearly with line numbers. Support editing of command, args, and env properties.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify JSON validation catches syntax errors, test add/edit/remove operations preserve config integrity

subtasks.title: Implement async Test Connection via IPC
subtasks.description: Build an asynchronous connection testing feature that communicates with the main process through IPC to verify MCP server connectivity
subtasks.details: Create IPC communication layer to send connection test requests to main process. Implement async/await pattern for test requests. Add loading state during connection attempts. Display success/error results with detailed error messages. Handle timeout scenarios and connection retries.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test with valid and invalid server configs, verify timeout handling, confirm error messages display properly

subtasks.title: Implement health monitoring with polling
subtasks.description: Create a health monitoring system that polls MCP servers at intervals and displays real-time status indicators
subtasks.details: Implement polling mechanism with configurable intervals to check server health status. Create visual status indicators (green/yellow/red) for each server. Handle health check failures gracefully. Allow users to pause/resume monitoring. Store last known status and update UI reactively.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify status indicators update correctly on polling, test pause/resume functionality, confirm status persistence

subtasks.title: Fetch and display available tools per server
subtasks.description: Implement functionality to fetch available tools from each connected MCP server and display them in the UI
subtasks.details: Create IPC handlers to request available tools list from MCP servers. Parse and display tool names, descriptions, and parameters in a structured format. Handle large tool lists with proper scrolling or pagination. Update tool list when server configuration changes. Implement caching to reduce redundant requests.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify tools display correctly after connection, test caching behavior, confirm tool list updates on config changes

tasks.expansionPrompt: Define subtasks for MCP management: 1) Parsing the claude_desktop_config.json file, 2) Building a JSON editor for server configurations, 3) Implementing an async 'Test Connection' feature via IPC, 4) Polling/monitoring server health status, and 5) Fetching and displaying available tools per server.

tasks.title: Implement Settings Tab
tasks.description: Build the Settings editor with JSON validation for .claude/settings.json, model preferences, environment variables, and theme settings.
tasks.details: Create Settings component reading .claude/settings.json. Use Monaco/CodeMirror with JSON schema validation for editing. Implement allowed tools configuration UI. Add model preferences selector. Build environment variables editor. Create theme/appearance settings UI. Validate all JSON changes before saving. Apply theme changes immediately. Handle missing settings.json with default values.
tasks.testStrategy: Edit settings.json with validation catching errors. Verify allowed tools UI saves correctly. Test model preferences selection. Confirm environment variables persist. Check theme changes apply immediately. Validate default values used for missing config.

subtasks.title: Implement settings.json file operations
subtasks.description: Create functions to read and write the .claude/settings.json file with proper error handling and default value support
subtasks.details: Implement file system operations to read .claude/settings.json. Handle missing files by returning default settings. Implement write functionality with atomic operations. Add JSON schema validation for read/write operations using Monaco/CodeMirror integration.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test reading existing settings.json, missing file returns defaults, writing validates JSON structure, and concurrent write handling

subtasks.title: Build model preferences and environment variables forms
subtasks.description: Create form UI components for model selection and environment variable management
subtasks.details: Implement allowed tools configuration UI with checkboxes. Add model preferences selector with dropdown for choosing available models. Build environment variables editor with add/edit/delete key-value pairs. Validate all form inputs before saving to settings.json.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify model selection saves correctly, environment variables persist after add/edit/delete operations, and form validation catches invalid inputs

subtasks.title: Implement theme switcher and appearance settings
subtasks.description: Create theme selection UI and logic to apply theme changes immediately
subtasks.details: Create theme/appearance settings UI with live preview options. Implement immediate theme application without page refresh using CSS variables. Add theme options including light, dark, and auto/system detection. Save theme preference to settings.json and apply on application load.
subtasks.testStrategy: Confirm theme changes apply immediately, theme selection persists across sessions, and auto/system theme follows OS preferences correctly

tasks.expansionPrompt: Create subtasks for the Settings tab: 1) Reading and writing .claude/settings.json, 2) Building form inputs for model preferences and environment variables, and 3) Implementing the theme switcher logic.

tasks.title: Implement Cross-Project Operations
tasks.description: Build bulk operations, templates, sync, and migration features for applying configurations across multiple projects.
tasks.details: Implement bulk operations UI for selecting multiple projects. Create templates system to save configurations as reusable templates. Build sync functionality to copy configurations between projects. Add migration feature to move configurations. Implement automatic backups before any modification using git or file copies. Add activity log tracking all configuration changes. Create global search across all configurations. Validate operations before applying.
tasks.testStrategy: Apply hooks/rules/skills to multiple projects successfully. Create and apply templates correctly. Test sync between projects. Verify migrations work as expected. Confirm automatic backups created before changes. Validate activity log records all operations. Test global search finds configurations.

subtasks.title: Build Multi-Select Project Selection UI
subtasks.description: Create a user interface component for selecting multiple projects simultaneously for bulk operations.
subtasks.details: Implement a multi-select dropdown or list component with checkboxes. Add filtering/search capabilities for projects. Implement select all/deselect all functionality. Display selected projects as tags/chips. Ensure responsive design for large project lists. Include project metadata display (path, last modified).
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify multiple projects can be selected and deselected. Test select all/deselect all functionality. Validate filtering works correctly. Check UI responsiveness with many projects. Confirm project metadata displays accurately.

subtasks.title: Create Template System for Configurations
subtasks.description: Build a system to save and load configuration sets as reusable templates across projects.
subtasks.details: Define template structure (metadata + config data). Create template storage format (JSON). Implement save template dialog for capturing current project settings. Build load template functionality for applying templates to selected projects. Add template management UI (list, edit, delete). Support template export/import for sharing.
subtasks.testStrategy: Save a template from current project. Apply template to multiple projects and verify configurations match. Test template management operations. Validate export/import preserves template data. Confirm template metadata is preserved correctly.

subtasks.title: Implement Sync Logic Between Projects
subtasks.description: Build synchronization functionality to copy .claude configuration data between project repositories.
subtasks.details: Implement file copying logic for .claude directory contents. Handle conflicts (source vs target modifications). Provide diff preview before sync. Support selective sync (hooks, rules, skills individually). Add progress indication for sync operations. Validate target project structure before sync. Include dry-run mode for testing.
subtasks.testStrategy: Sync configurations between projects successfully. Test conflict detection and resolution. Verify selective sync works for individual components. Confirm diff preview shows accurate changes. Validate dry-run mode shows planned changes without modifying files.

subtasks.title: Add Configuration Migration Feature
subtasks.description: Create a migration tool to move configurations from one project structure to another with transformation support.
subtasks.details: Implement migration wizard with step-by-step guidance. Support source/destination project selection. Add transformation rules for path mappings. Provide preview of migration changes. Handle migration rollback capability. Validate migrated configurations apply correctly in new structure. Support partial migrations (specific config types).
subtasks.testStrategy: Migrate configurations between projects successfully. Test transformation rules handle path changes correctly. Verify preview shows accurate migration plan. Confirm rollback restores original state. Validate partial migrations work for selected config types.

subtasks.title: Implement Automatic Backup System
subtasks.description: Build an automatic backup mechanism that creates git commits or file snapshots before any configuration modifications.
subtasks.details: Detect git repository status and use git commits when available. Fall back to file snapshots in non-git projects. Timestamp backup files appropriately. Implement backup rotation/cleanup policies. Create backup restoration UI. Log all backup operations. Ensure minimal performance impact. Store backup metadata (operation, timestamp, affected files).
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify backups created before any modification. Test git commit fallback to file snapshots. Confirm backup restoration works correctly. Validate backup cleanup policies. Check backup logging accuracy. Test backup rotation removes old backups correctly.

subtasks.title: Create Activity Log for Auditing
subtasks.description: Build a comprehensive activity log that tracks all configuration changes across projects.
subtasks.details: Define activity log schema (timestamp, user, operation, project, changes). Implement logging for all configuration CRUD operations. Add filtering and search for log entries. Create activity log viewer UI with pagination. Support log export for compliance. Ensure thread-safe logging for concurrent operations. Include backup/restore events in log.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify all operations are logged correctly. Test filtering and search functionality. Validate log export produces readable output. Confirm log viewer displays all necessary information. Test logging under concurrent operations for data integrity.

subtasks.title: Build Global Search Index Across Projects
subtasks.description: Create a global search capability that indexes and searches configuration files across all projects.
subtasks.details: Build indexer for hooks, rules, skills, and settings files. Support full-text search with highlighting. Implement filter by project and configuration type. Add real-time search with debouncing. Create search results UI with context preview. Support advanced search syntax (quotes, wildcards, exclusions). Re-index on configuration changes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Search across all projects and verify results accuracy. Test filtering by project and type. Confirm real-time search performs well. Validate advanced search syntax works correctly. Verify re-indexing triggers on configuration changes.

tasks.expansionPrompt: Break down the advanced features: 1) Building a multi-select UI for projects, 2) Creating the template system (save/load config sets), 3) Implementing sync logic (copying .claude data between repos), 4) Adding a migration feature, 5) Implementing automatic backups (git or file snapshots) before modifications, 6) Creating an activity log for auditing, and 7) Building a global search index across all projects.
